actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 1 of H. Res. 1230. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 p.m. on December 7, 2022.

actions-list.header: SPECIAL ORDER SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: ONE MINUTE SPEECHES
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 396
actions-list.actionItem: 24 (Roll no. 511).
Considered as unfinished business.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 421
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 510).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 4834 — "To reauthorize the National Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force Program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408
actions-list.actionItem: 11 (Roll no. 509).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 2796 — "To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to provide for the eligibility of rural community response pilot programs for funding under the Comprehensive Opioid Abuse Grant Program, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 424
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 508).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3499 — "To amend the Post-Katrina Emergency Management Reform Act of 2006 to repeal certain obsolete requirements, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 333
actions-list.actionItem: 92 (Roll no. 507).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3875 — "To require the President to develop and maintain products that show the risk of natural hazards across the United States, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 417
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 506).
Considered as unfinished business.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408
actions-list.actionItem: 17 (Roll no. 505).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 4052 — "To reauthorize a program for early detection, diagnosis, and treatment regarding deaf and hard-of-hearing newborns, infants, and young children, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: UNFINISHED BUSINESS
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

actions-list.header: On Motion to Suspend the Rules and Pass Certain Bills Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 380
actions-list.actionItem: 46 (Roll no. 504).

The Chair announced that pursuant to section 3 of H. Res. 1508, the ordering of the yeas and nays oon postponed motions to suspend the rules with respect to such measures would be vacated to the end that all such motions would be considered as withdrawn.
Purusant to section 3 of H. Res. 1508, Mr. Hoyer moved to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 8844; S. 198, as amended; and S. 1687, as amended
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 220
On agreeing to the Gonzalez, Vicente amendment; Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A002) and on the bill pursuant to the rule.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1508, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Vicente Gonzalez amendment no. 1.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Gonzalez, Vicente,  numbered 1 printed in Part C of House Report 117-590 to require the Secretary of Homeland Security to promulgate regulations to implement this Act not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 7946.

The resolution provides consideration of H.R. 3648, under a structured rule and H.R. 7946, under a structured rule. The resolution waives the requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committeee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to any resolution reported through the remainder of the 117th Congress.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1508. H.R. 7946 — "To provide benefits for noncitizen members of the Armed Forces, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 215

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1508 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3648) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to eliminate the per-country numerical limitation for employment-based immigrants, to increase the per-country numerical limitation for family-sponsored immigrants, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7946) to provide benefits for noncitizen members of the Armed Forces, and for other purposes; and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: UNFINISHED BUSINESS
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the unfinished business was on agreeing to H. Res. 1508, which was debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 6.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS
actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1508, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mrs. Fischbach demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair announced that further proceedings on agreeing to the resolution would be postponed.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

actions-list.header: DEBATE
actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1508.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1508 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3648) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to eliminate the per-country numerical limitation for employment-based immigrants, to increase the per-country numerical limitation for family-sponsored immigrants, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7946) to provide benefits for noncitizen members of the Armed Forces, and for other purposes; and for other purposes."
Mr. McGovern filed a report from the Committee on Rules on H. Res. 1508.

actions-list.header: PLEDGE OF ALLEGIANCE
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair designated Mr. McGovern to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
